summary: This is a search warrant issued by the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York, authorizing the search and seizure of compact discs (FBI evidence numbers 15, 16, 17, 18, 22) from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence. The warrant seeks evidence related to violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy) and 1591 (sex trafficking of minors), including communications, photographs, and records concerning victims.

persons.name: Hon. Barbara Moses
persons.context: Issued the search and seizure warrant for compact discs from Epstein's New York residence.

events.title: Seizure of Evidence from Epstein Residence
events.description: Compact discs stored in containers marked with FBI evidence numbers 15, 16, 17, 18, and 22 were seized from 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY.

events.title: Search Warrant Issuance
events.description: Judge Barbara Moses issued a search warrant authorizing the forensic examination of seized compact discs for evidence of sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, New York
keyFacts: The warrant authorizes search of compact discs (FBI evidence numbers 15, 16, 17, 18, 22) seized from Epstein's New York residence on July 7, 2019.
The search seeks evidence of violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy) and 1591 (sex trafficking of minors).
Items to be seized include communications with victims, photographs of teenage girls, child erotica, and records of device ownership/use.
The warrant allows forensic imaging and review using techniques like keyword searches and file recovery to locate evidence.
Judge Barbara Moses authorized the warrant, which had to be executed by July 21, 2019.
